text: Louis Cha Jing-yong () (10 March 1924 â€“ 30 October 2018), better known by his pen name Jin Yong, was a Chinese novelist and essayist. He co-founded the Hong Kong daily newspaper Ming Pao in 1959 and was its first editor-in-chief. He was Hong Kong's most famous writer. He was born in Haining, Zhejiang. He retired from the newspaper business in 1993. Yong died after a long illness at a hospital in Happy Valley, Hong Kong on 30 October 2018 at the age of 94. ==Related pages== *List of Chinese writers ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Hong Kong people Category:Chinese novelists Category:Chinese journalists Category:Essayists Category:Chinese businesspeople Category:Writers from Zhejiang Category:20th-century Chinese writers
